intro: Eutrochium purpureum var. holzingeri, commonly known as the Holzinger's purple coneflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It features showy, violet-blue to purple flower heads that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces and grows to a height of approximately 1 to 2 meters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
